review: This was so easy to set up and works well with my wall mounted television.  Doesn't loose connection to my WIFI which is down in the basement.  I would certainly by another one.  This is on my set in the bedroom and the light for the roku/power connection is quite bright.  I put a piece of tape over it.  Also my HDMI outputs are on the back of the set so  I have to be careful not to crush the roku when I adjust the viewing angle of the TV.  I have a small television.
author: Stephanie A. White

review: It works fine but not without compromise. Be better off buying the full Roku...3-25-2015 UpdateI still feel the same way, buy the full ROKU 3 and you will be rewarded as it's not that much more. Some of the compromise I get is that when I need to rewind or fast forward it's a hassle because it's like it needs to literally break the connection first then rewind or fast forward. That process takes about a full 5 sec or more. So the best thing to do is to press play and forget about it.4-12-2015I have to admit, most  of the movies I stream are in full 1080p. I played a movie that was in 720p and it worked just fine. So if anything above that will have to be compromised. The ROKU II that's been refreshed is probably a better buy with not nearly the trade off with the the STICK.
